Hi all
It seems that the IG builder currently fails due to problems with the terminology server.
Does anyone else have the same problem.

The error reported is: Publishing Content Failed: Unable to connect to terminology server. Use parameter '-tx n/a' tun run without using terminology services to validate LOINC, SNOMED, ICD-X etc. Error = Error sending Http Request: Connect to tx.fhir.org:80 timed out (followed by a FHIRExeption ending the build)

I use FHIR Shorthand so I do not call it myself (I use the _genonce.bat script generated by sushi).
the advice in that error is not applicable to the Publisher, so I'll see if I can remove it

Grahame Grieve said:

I have restarted tx.fhir.org

Forgot to thank you - hereby done ;-)

Hi all, it seems that the server tx.fhir.org is down. When executing IG Publisher I get the info that it operates in offline mode but fails to finish it creation with an exception. A quick lookup on tx.fhir.org yielded that it is not responding.

It states a warning, however fails to execute:

WARNING: Running without terminology server - terminology content will likely not publish correctly (00:10.0434)

thankful for any help.
Does that also explain the lack of successful runs on https://fhir.github.io/auto-ig-builder/builds.html
i'm working hard on re-engineering the terminology server.
